data.name: BinaryInput
data.value: Binary

data.name: EmptyPlaceholder
data.value: is empty. Placeholders must at least specify a (previously defined) {<name>} or a valid type letter prefixed with a colon {:<T>} .

data.name: EmptyTemplate
data.value: The format template is empty. Enter at least one placeholder enclosed in {}.

data.name: ExplicitMappingInvalidRange
data.value: contains a misformed range for a text representation. Ranges consist of optional numbers with .. in between. Numbers must use comma as the decimal separator, and cannot contain group (thousands) separators. Prefix range boundaries with > (for lower boundaries), or < (upper boundaries), to indicate that the respective value itself should be treated as out of the range.

data.name: ExplicitMappingInvalidValue
data.value: contains a misformed number for a text representation. Numbers use comma as the decimal separator (if needed), and cannot contain group (thousands) separators.

data.name: ExplicitMappingInvRngVal
data.value: contains a misformed range boundary (number) for a text representation. Numbers must use comma as the decimal separator, and cannot contain group (thousands) separators. Prefix range boundaries with > (for lower boundaries), or < (upper boundaries), to indicate that the respective value itself should be treated as out of the range.

data.name: IntegerInput
data.value: Integer

data.name: MappingNoExplicitValues
data.value: contains a mix of implicit and explicit values for text representations. This generally not allowable. Integer text representations can either exclusively use implicit values or value ranges, or exclusively use explicit values or value ranges. Floating point numer representations can only use explicit values or value ranges.

data.name: MappingNoImplicitValues
data.value: uses implicit values for text representations. Floating point number representations generally can't use implicit values. Integer representations don't support mixing implicit and explicit values.

data.name: MappingWrongAssignment
data.value: contains an invalid assignment for a text representation. Valid assignments contain exactly one = between value or range (left hand side) and the text (right hand side).

data.name: NoPlaceholder
data.value: The format template contains no placeholders. Enclose placeholders in {}.

data.name: NumberInput
data.value: Number

data.name: Output
data.value: Output

data.name: PlaceholderBinLengthInvalid
data.value: is misformed. Binary (boolean) placeholders take either no parameters ({:B}), two character parameters ({:Bxy}), or a list of two string parameters ({B|false|true}).

data.name: PlaceholderIntLengthInvalid
data.value: is misformed. Integer placeholders ({:I}) support no precision parameter. Optionally, values or value ranges can be specified with text representations (like in [:I|0=null|..<0=negative|>0..=positive}).

data.name: PlaceholderMultipleColon
data.value: is misformed. A placeholder can contain no more than one ':', which separates the input name (left hand side) from type and formatting information (right hand side).

data.name: PlaceholderNameNotFound
data.value: is an invalid reference. The input name has not been defined before. A type must be given with the input name upon first use. Type characters must be specified with a prefixed colon.

data.name: PlaceholderNumFormatInvalid
data.value: is misformed. Number placeholders take either no parameters ({:N}), or a one-digit precision parameter ({N1}) after their type letter. Values or value ranges can optionally be specified with text representations (like in {:N|..<0=underflow|>1000..=overflow}).

data.name: PlaceholderReuseWrongType
data.value: refers to a previously defined input name, but specifies a different type. A reference can only redefine the formatting, but not the type, of the used input.

data.name: PlaceholderStrLengthInvalid
data.value: is misformed. The string ({:S}) placeholder does not support any parameters.

data.name: PlaceholderTypeInvalid
data.value: is an unknown placeholder type. Only the following type characters can be used (as upper or lower case): B → Binary (boolean); I → Integer; F, N, G, P → Floating point number (double) specifying different formats; S → Text (string).

data.name: StringInput
data.value: Text

data.name: Template
data.value: Format Template

data.name: TooManyBinPlaceholders
data.value: The format template contains too many binary ({:B}) placeholders.

data.name: TooManyIntPlaceholders
data.value: The format template contains too many integer ({:I}) placeholders.

data.name: TooManyNumPlaceholders
data.value: The format template contains too many floating point number (({:F}, {:N}, {:G} and/or {:P}) placeholders.

data.name: TooManyPlaceholders
data.value: The format template contains too many placeholders.

data.name: TooManyStrPlaceholders
data.value: The format template contains too many string ({:S}) placeholders.

data.name: PlaceholderNameInvalid
data.value: contains an invalid input name. Valid names start with a letter and optionally continue with letters, digits, blanks (not at the end) or punctuation. The characters :, {, und } cannot be used, because these would be ambiguous with surrounding syntax elements.

data.name: ExplicitMappingInvertedRange
data.value: contains a text representation with a value range where the upper bound is no larger than the lower bound.

data.name: PlaceholderBinInvalidAssign
data.value: contains a text representation with an explicit value assignment. This is generally not supported for binary values. Use implicit values for text representations in {:B} placeholders.

data.name: PlaceholderBinSameText
data.value: has the same text representation for false and true values. Text representations must be different (and only one of them can be empty).

data.name: MappingEmptyImplicitValue
data.value: contains an empty text representation. This is only allowed when a value is explicitly given, but not for implicit values.

data.name: HasDefaultName
data.value: uses a default name, which is not allowable in this context. Specify an explicit name before the :.

data.name: HasFormatOrMappings
data.value: contains a format specification or text mappings, which is not allowable in this context. Specify only a valid type letter.

data.name: HasUnusableName
data.value: has a name that uses special characters, which is not allowable in this context. Specify a name starting with a letter and using only letters, digits, and _.

data.name: Expression
data.value: Expression

data.name: ExpressionCount
data.value: Number of Outputs and Expressions

data.name: OutType
data.value: Output Type

data.name: RuntimeError
data.value: Runtime Error

data.name: TemplateCount
data.value: Nu,mber of Outputs and Templates

data.name: HasOutOfRangeRef
data.value: contains a reference to an output that either doesn't exist or cannot be used here. Only outputs with numbers from 1 to n-1 can be used, where n is the number of the referencing expression.

data.name: HasAssignment
data.value: contains an assignment. This is generally not allowable in expressions.

data.name: NotFound
data.value: was not found in input text.

data.name: Path
data.value: Path

data.name: OutputCount
data.value: Number of Paths and Outputs

data.name: FirstAsNumber
data.value: First matching item as number

data.name: FirstAsNumberParam
data.value: Scaling factor

data.name: FirstAsText
data.value: First matching item as text

data.name: FirstAsTextParam
data.value: Text prefix

data.name: InvalidScaling
data.value: is not a valid scaling factor. Scaling factors must use . or , as the decimal separator and cannot use group (thousands) separators.

data.name: MultiAddNumbers
data.value: Sum of matching items as numbers

data.name: MultiAddNumbersParam
data.value: Scaling factor

data.name: MultiConcatTexts
data.value: Concatenate matching items as text

data.name: MultiConcatTextsParam
data.value: Text separator

data.name: NoXmlDouble
data.value: cannot converted to a number.

data.name: SelectOperation
data.value: Type of selection

data.name: SelectCode
data.value: Input coding
